    • Method Detail

      • splitByUnquotedWhitespace

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> splitByUnquotedWhitespace(java.lang.String string)
        Split the supplied line by unquoted whitespace.

        Note: The quotes are maintained in the returned value.

        White space within an open single quote will be ignored

        A quote can be escaped using a second single quote, e.g. "'escaped '' quote'".

        • "t0 t1" becomes ["t0", "t1"]
        • "'quoted string'" becomes ["'quoted string'"]
        • "'quoted 'connected' quoted'" becomes ["'quoted 'connected' quoted'"]
        • "'escaped '' quote'" becomes ["'escaped '' quote'"]
        Returns:
        the list of parts.

      • removeMatchedSingleQuotes

        public static java.lang.String removeMatchedSingleQuotes(java.lang.String string)
        Remove any matched, i.e. closed, single quotes from the supplied string.

        Works in a similar way to a unix command line would.

        A quote can be escaped using a second single quote, e.g. "'escaped '' quote'".

        e.g.

        • "unquoted" becomes "unquoted"
        • "'quoted string'" becomes "quoted string"
        • "'quoted'connected'quoted'" becomes "quotedconnectedquoted"
        • "'escaped '' quote'" becomes "escaped ' quote"
        Returns:
        the input with matched quotes removed.
